summary: PBVs are small non-enveloped bisegmented double-stranded RNA viruses found in human and a wide variety of mammals and birds. in 2012, we reported the discovery of a PBV, named otarine PBV (Ot-PBV), in a California sea lion (Zalophus californianus) in Hong Kong. as of December 31, 2015, 931 PBV nucleotide sequences have been submitted to GenBank. however, only nine are complete/near-complete segment 1 sequences and 21 are complete/near-complete segment 2 sequences. genogroup I PBVs may exist in different animals of the same species. those of pigs and cattle were collected from various locations in HKSAR. those of horses were collected with the assistance of the Hong Kong Jockey Club. all specimens of rabbits were collected from live food animal markets in Guangzhou, China, in October 2007.
